lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/goofy.Goofy.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run goofy.Goofy.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents the main entry point for the Goofy chatbot application.
* Goofy helps users manage their tasks via a command-line interface.
* Creates a new Goofy application instance.
* Runs the main command loop that reads and processes user input.
* Represents an exception specific to the Goofy application.
* Thrown when the user provides invalid input or commands.
* Creates a new GoofyException with the given error message.
* @param message Error message describing the exception.
* Parses user input and executes the corresponding commands.

* Parses and executes the given user input command.
* @param ui Ui instance for displaying results.
* @throws GoofyException If the command is invalid or input is malformed.
public void parseCommand(String input, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws GoofyException {
throw new GoofyException("\"" + input + "\"?? A-hyuck, I have NO idea what that means! "
+ "Try one of these instead: todo, deadline, event, list, mark, unmark, bye.");
* Parses and executes a todo command.
* @param tasks TaskList to add the task to.
* @param ui Ui instance for displaying results.
* @throws GoofyException If the todo description is empty.
private void parseTodo(String input, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws GoofyException {
throw new GoofyException("Gawrsh, a todo with no name? Even I'm not that forgetful! "

* Parses and executes a deadline command.

* @param ui Ui instance for displaying results.

private void parseDeadline(String input, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws GoofyException {
throw new GoofyException("Whoa there! A deadline needs more info than that! "
throw new GoofyException("You forgot the /by part! How will I know when it's due?! "
throw new GoofyException("Gawrsh, both a description AND a date are needed! "

throw new GoofyException("Whoa, I need both /from AND /to or I'll get lost! "

* Manages the list of tasks in the Goofy application.

throw new GoofyException("Task number " + taskNumber + "?! That ain't on the list! "
+ "I only see " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in there, a-hyuck!");
* Marks the task at the given one-based task number as not done.

+ "I only see " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in there, a-hyuck!");
